availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Kentucky McCracken County Sct
Monday Octo 20th 1862. -- Called Court
Prest Hon G. A. Flournoy

It is ordered that George Smedley is recom^m^ended to his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky as a suitable person to fill the office of Justice of the Peace in McCracken County in District No 1 to fill the vacancy caused by the removal of Peter Anderson who has removed from this County. And David C Peters is also recommended as a suitable person to fill the office of Justice of the Peace in McCracken County in District No 7 to fill the vacancy caused by the removal of George Smedley who has removed from that District

James Spence C. M. C. C.
A Copy Att
